channel.title: Tech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Tech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: India, the market BlaBlaCar once walked away from, is now its biggest
item.description: BlaBlaCar is seeing rapid growth in India, with 20 million passengers expected this year — up 50% from last year.

item.title: TikTok robot star Rizzbot gave me the middle finger
item.description: About a week ago, I woke to a dizzying DM on Instagram — Rizzbot flipping me off. This sent me down a rabbit hole about humanoids in society.

item.title: DHS Wants a Fleet of AI-Powered Surveillance Trucks
item.description: US border patrol is asking companies to submit plans to turn standard 4x4 trucks into AI-powered watchtowers—combining radar, cameras, and autonomous ...

item.title: OpenAI reportedly developing new generative music tool
item.description: Such a tool could be used to add music to existing videos, or to add guitar accompaniment to an existing vocal track, sources said.

item.title: High school’s AI security system confuses Doritos bag for a possible firearm
item.description: A high school student in Baltimore County, Maryland was reportedly handcuffed and searched after an AI security system flagged his bag of chips as a p...

item.title: Who are AI browsers for?
item.description: OpenAI launched an AI-powered browser this week, but it feels like it offers a slight efficiency gain at best.

item.title: How to use the new ChatGPT app integrations, including Spotify, Figma, Canva, and others
item.description: Learn how to use Spotify, Canva, Figma, Expedia, and other apps directly in ChatGPT.

item.title: OpenAI's Sora Loses Its Top App Store Ranking to Dave's Hot Chicken
item.description: Dave’s Hot Chicken is the top app in the iOS App Store, ending Sora’s weeks-long reign.

item.title: A comprehensive list of 2025 tech layoffs
item.description: A complete list of all the known layoffs in tech, from Big Tech to startups, broken down by month throughout 2024.

item.title: Astronomers Have Discovered Earth’s Latest Quasi-Lunar Moon
item.description: As mankind was planning the first moon landing in the 1960s, an asteroid approached Earth—and still hasn’t left.
